Other Information.Test Conditions: 0.2 bar, varying voltage (-1.5 V to +1.5 V), 10 mM Na2SO4
Other Information.Additional Info: Electrostatic repulsion at -1.5 V enhances rejection efficiency and reduces membrane fouling.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 0.2 bar, varying voltage (+0.5 V to +2.0 V), 10 mM Na2SO4
Other Information.Additional Info: Removal efficiency increases with positive voltage due to electrochemical oxidation at potentials > +0.8 V.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 0.2 bar, varying voltage (+0.5 V to +1.5 V), 10 mM Na2SO4
Other Information.Additional Info: Significant removal (>90%) achieved at +1.0 V due to electrochemical oxidation.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion for larger molecules; adsorption and electrochemical oxidation for smaller molecules.

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, cyclic voltammetry, linear sweep voltammetry
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: PS microsphere removal: ~85% at -1.5 V; Phenol removal: ~90% at +2.0 V; Methyl orange removal: ~100% at +1.0 V

Other Information.Additional Info: The PCM exhibits enhanced permeability, selectivity, and antifouling capability under electrochemical assistance.
